verses.text_plain: If thou wilt return, O Israel, saith the Lord, return unto me: and if thou wilt put away thine abominations out of my sight, then shalt thou not remove.
verses.verse_html: 1If thou wilt return, O Israel, saith the Lord, return unto me: and if thou wilt put away thine abominations out of my sight, then shalt thou not remove.

tokens.text: unto me: and if thou wilt put away

verses.text_plain: And thou shalt swear, The Lord liveth, in truth, in judgment, and in righteousness; and the nations shall bless themselves in him, and in him shall they glory.
verses.verse_html: 2And thou shalt swear, The Lord liveth, in truth, in judgment, and in righteousness; and the nations shall bless themselves in him, and in him shall they glory.

tokens.text: themselves in him, and in him shall they glory

verses.text_plain: For thus saith the Lord to the men of Judah and Jerusalem, Break up your fallow ground, and sow not among thorns.
verses.verse_html: 3For thus saith the Lord to the men of Judah and Jerusalem, Break up your fallow ground, and sow not among thorns.

verses.text_plain: Circumcise yourselves to the Lord, and take away the foreskins of your heart, ye men of Judah and inhabitants of Jerusalem: lest my fury come forth like fire, and burn that none can quench it, because of the evil of your doings.
verses.verse_html: 4Circumcise yourselves to the Lord, and take away the foreskins of your heart, ye men of Judah and inhabitants of Jerusalem: lest my fury come forth like fire, and burn that none can quench it, because of the evil of your doings.

verses.text_plain: Declare ye in Judah, and publish in Jerusalem; and say, Blow ye the trumpet in the land: cry, gather together, and say, Assemble yourselves, and let us go into the defenced cities.
verses.verse_html: 5Declare ye in Judah, and publish in Jerusalem; and say, Blow ye the trumpet in the land: cry, gather together, and say, Assemble yourselves, and let us go into the defenced cities.

verses.text_plain: Set up the standard toward Zion: retire, stay not: for I will bring evil from the north, and a great destruction.
verses.verse_html:
6Set up the standard toward Zion: retire, stay not: for I will bring evil from the north, and a great destruction.
 retire: or, strengthen
 ,
 destruction: Heb. breaking

verses.text_plain: The lion is come up from his thicket, and the destroyer of the Gentiles is on his way; he is gone forth from his place to make thy land desolate; and thy cities shall be laid waste, without an inhabitant.
verses.verse_html: 7The lion is come up from his thicket, and the destroyer of the Gentiles is on his way; he is gone forth from his place to make thy land desolate; and thy cities shall be laid waste, without an inhabitant.

verses.text_plain: For this gird you with sackcloth, lament and howl: for the fierce anger of the Lord is not turned back from us.
verses.verse_html: 8For this gird you with sackcloth, lament and howl: for the fierce anger of the Lord is not turned back from us.

verses.text_plain: And it shall come to pass at that day, saith the Lord, that the heart of the king shall perish, and the heart of the princes; and the priests shall be astonished, and the prophets shall wonder.
verses.verse_html: 9And it shall come to pass at that day, saith the Lord, that the heart of the king shall perish, and the heart of the princes; and the priests shall be astonished, and the prophets shall wonder.

tokens.text: And it shall come to pass at that day

verses.text_plain: Then said I, Ah, Lord God! surely thou hast greatly deceived this people and Jerusalem, saying, Ye shall have peace; whereas the sword reacheth unto the soul.
verses.verse_html: 10Then said I, Ah, Lord God! surely thou hast greatly deceived this people and Jerusalem, saying, Ye shall have peace; whereas the sword reacheth unto the soul.

verses.text_plain: At that time shall it be said to this people and to Jerusalem, A dry wind of the high places in the wilderness toward the daughter of my people, not to fan, nor to cleanse,
verses.verse_html: 11At that time shall it be said to this people and to Jerusalem, A dry wind of the high places in the wilderness toward the daughter of my people, not to fan, nor to cleanse,

verses.text_plain: Even a full wind from those places shall come unto me: now also will I give sentence against them.
verses.verse_html:
12Even a full wind from those places shall come unto me: now also will I give sentence against them.
 a full: or, a fuller wind than those
 ,
 give: Heb. utter judgments

tokens.text: unto me: now also will I give

footnotes.body_text: a full: or, a fuller wind than those
footnotes.body_html: a full: or, a fuller wind than those
give: Heb. utter judgments

verses.text_plain: Behold, he shall come up as clouds, and his chariots shall be as a whirlwind: his horses are swifter than eagles. Woe unto us! for we are spoiled.
verses.verse_html: 13Behold, he shall come up as clouds, and his chariots shall be as a whirlwind: his horses are swifter than eagles. Woe unto us! for we are spoiled.

tokens.text: unto us! for we are spoiled

verses.text_plain: O Jerusalem, wash thine heart from wickedness, that thou mayest be saved. How long shall thy vain thoughts lodge within thee?
verses.verse_html: 14O Jerusalem, wash thine heart from wickedness, that thou mayest be saved. How long shall thy vain thoughts lodge within thee?

verses.text_plain: For a voice declareth from Dan, and publisheth affliction from mount Ephraim.
verses.verse_html: 15For a voice declareth from Dan, and publisheth affliction from mount Ephraim.

verses.text_plain: Make ye mention to the nations; behold, publish against Jerusalem, that watchers come from a far country, and give out their voice against the cities of Judah.
verses.verse_html: 16Make ye mention to the nations; behold, publish against Jerusalem, that watchers come from a far country, and give out their voice against the cities of Judah.

verses.text_plain: As keepers of a field, are they against her round about; because she hath been rebellious against me, saith the Lord.
verses.verse_html: 17As keepers of a field, are they against her round about; because she hath been rebellious against me, saith the Lord.

tokens.text: are they against her round about

verses.text_plain: Thy way and thy doings have procured these things unto thee; this is thy wickedness, because it is bitter, because it reacheth unto thine heart.
verses.verse_html: 18Thy way and thy doings have procured these things unto thee; this is thy wickedness, because it is bitter, because it reacheth unto thine heart.

verses.text_plain: My bowels, my bowels! I am pained at my very heart; my heart maketh a noise in me; I cannot hold my peace, because thou hast heard, O my soul, the sound of the trumpet, the alarm of war.
verses.verse_html:
19My bowels, my bowels! I am pained at my very heart; my heart maketh a noise in me; I cannot hold my peace, because thou hast heard, O my soul, the sound of the trumpet, the alarm of war.
 my very: Heb. the walls of my heart

tokens.text: in me; I cannot hold my peace

footnotes.body_text: my very: Heb. the walls of my heart
footnotes.body_html: my very: Heb. the walls of my heart

verses.text_plain: Destruction upon destruction is cried; for the whole land is spoiled: suddenly are my tents spoiled, and my curtains in a moment.
verses.verse_html: 20Destruction upon destruction is cried; for the whole land is spoiled: suddenly are my tents spoiled, and my curtains in a moment.

verses.text_plain: How long shall I see the standard, and hear the sound of the trumpet?
verses.verse_html: 21How long shall I see the standard, and hear the sound of the trumpet?

verses.text_plain: For my people is foolish, they have not known me; they are sottish children, and they have none understanding: they are wise to do evil, but to do good they have no knowledge.
verses.verse_html: 22For my people is foolish, they have not known me; they are sottish children, and they have none understanding: they are wise to do evil, but to do good they have no knowledge.

verses.text_plain: I beheld the earth, and, lo, it was without form, and void; and the heavens, and they had no light.
verses.verse_html: 23I beheld the earth, and, lo, it was without form, and void; and the heavens, and they had no light.

verses.text_plain: I beheld the mountains, and, lo, they trembled, and all the hills moved lightly.
verses.verse_html: 24I beheld the mountains, and, lo, they trembled, and all the hills moved lightly.

verses.text_plain: I beheld, and, lo, there was no man, and all the birds of the heavens were fled.
verses.verse_html: 25I beheld, and, lo, there was no man, and all the birds of the heavens were fled.

verses.text_plain: I beheld, and, lo, the fruitful place was a wilderness, and all the cities thereof were broken down at the presence of the Lord, and by his fierce anger.
verses.verse_html: 26I beheld, and, lo, the fruitful place was a wilderness, and all the cities thereof were broken down at the presence of the Lord, and by his fierce anger.

verses.text_plain: For thus hath the Lord said, The whole land shall be desolate; yet will I not make a full end.
verses.verse_html: 27For thus hath the Lord said, The whole land shall be desolate; yet will I not make a full end.

verses.text_plain: For this shall the earth mourn, and the heavens above be black: because I have spoken it, I have purposed it, and will not repent, neither will I turn back from it.
verses.verse_html: 28For this shall the earth mourn, and the heavens above be black: because I have spoken it, I have purposed it, and will not repent, neither will I turn back from it.

verses.text_plain: The whole city shall flee for the noise of the horsemen and bowmen; they shall go into thickets, and climb up upon the rocks: every city shall be forsaken, and not a man dwell therein.
verses.verse_html: 29The whole city shall flee for the noise of the horsemen and bowmen; they shall go into thickets, and climb up upon the rocks: every city shall be forsaken, and not a man dwell therein.

verses.text_plain: And when thou art spoiled, what wilt thou do? Though thou clothest thyself with crimson, though thou deckest thee with ornaments of gold, though thou rentest thy face with painting, in vain shalt thou make thyself fair; thy lovers will despise thee, they will seek thy life.
verses.verse_html:
30And when thou art spoiled, what wilt thou do? Though thou clothest thyself with crimson, though thou deckest thee with ornaments of gold, though thou rentest thy face with painting, in vain shalt thou make thyself fair; thy lovers will despise thee, they will seek thy life.
 face: Heb. eyes

verses.text_plain: For I have heard a voice as of a woman in travail, and the anguish as of her that bringeth forth her first child, the voice of the daughter of Zion, that bewaileth herself, that spreadeth her hands, saying, Woe is me now! for my soul is wearied because of murderers.
verses.verse_html: 31For I have heard a voice as of a woman in travail, and the anguish as of her that bringeth forth her first child, the voice of the daughter of Zion, that bewaileth herself, that spreadeth her hands, saying, Woe is me now! for my soul is wearied because of murderers.

tokens.text: as of a woman in travail
as of her that bringeth forth her first child
